text: The PC Engine had the better overall game. Just the SNES sound chip was leagues better.

text: Are you fucking kidding me. Have you even played Rondo of Blood? The SNES version has some good tracks on it, yes, but you'd have to be on something serious to say it's better than the original PCE soundtrack.
author: SJtheMFZB

text: @SJtheMFZB Yes, although not because the PCE's soundchip was better, but because it was the PC Engine CD which used Red Book audio (i.e. streamed). They're both fantastic soundtracks though.
author: batlin

text: Comparing the PCE's CV sound to SNES's CV sound is like comparing sex to masturbation. Sure, you feel good after jerking off, but why settle to the fake one when you can have sex for real? PCE > SNES

text: the sounds from the  PC engine are just awful.
author: Nähwichtel Nähen

text: Great
author: SonoraGamers

text: As I already mentioned, as much as I like the original PC Engine soundtrack, there's something about the crisp SNES version I absolutely love. Thinking about it, this game's soundtrack is full of awesome intros that immediately get me into its themes. The guitar in this one, the percussion in Opus 13 (#433) and the moody ambience in Beginning (#272).
author: SupraDarky

text: Well, I've already been getting into a bit of a Castlevania mood, so why not?
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: For some reason, this track sounds better on SNES. This game overall has a cleaner PC engine soundtrack, but some SNES tracks manage to be better.

text: @SupraDarky This is one of the Snes themes I also prefer over the PC Engine version.
